snippet.title: [MSX2] Action RPG Construction Tool Dante2 sample game "Legend of Lidroon" - Opening & Gameplay
snippet.description:
"Dante" is a fairly well-known RPG creation engine released on a myriad of retro microcomputers and video game consoles, which would eventually evolve into the "RPG Maker" franchise we're all familiar with today, but many may not be aware that there existed a "Dante2" for the MSX2 standard which allowed users to create their own bump combat-style action RPGs a la Ys I & II.

The pack-in sample game showing off what Dante2 could do (which, yes, even includes the opening cutscenes, as there are actually tools in place to create similarly complex animated cutscenes of your own!) is called "Legend of Lidroon," and not to be outdone by the Ys series' red-haired mainstay protagonist Adol Christin, players of this sample game take control of tow-headed adventurer Laydrock Steele, whose name is so unnecessarily badass it's almost self-parody. ;)

I haven't played enough of Legend of Lidroon to get past the boss seen in this video (as there's definitely a fair bit of grinding required to do so!), so I'm not sure how far beyond that the sample game goes, but it really is quite an impressive showpiece for the software, and is definitely a feather in the MSX's cap that's flown under far too many radars, deserving a lot more attention than it gets.

(English-translated subtitles are planned for eventual addition to this video, but probably not for a while. You're not missing a whole lot, though, if you can't read the text, as this game's story is basically exactly what you think it is.)
